@EPA @ENERGY @Pontifex Thank you to @CasinaPioIV and @Pontifex for your moral clarity and commitment to climate action and for including me in this historic event.
@EPA @ENERGY @Pontifex Christians are taking up the cause of climate change because they, too, believe we have a moral imperative to save the planet.
@EPA @ENERGY Nearly 1/3 of Congress identifies as Catholic, which is why @Pontifex's commitment to making climate action a priority is so important.
@EPA @ENERGY 7. The Church - They can show the moral imperative of climate action & the Vatican's leadership is critical in changing hearts & minds. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DNxxIFAVAAEKLP_.png
@EPA @ENERGY 6. The News Media- They must be more honest about the severity of the climate crisis and the real facts. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DNxw-8xVoAAkHUD.jpg
@EPA @ENERGY 5. Respected Republicans- Leaders who are no longer in office are important advocates for climate action. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DNxw3m1VQAE20qg.jpg

@EPA @ENERGY 4. American Businesses- Everyone will have to compete with China, who called for 1/5 of cars sold to run on alternative fuel within 8 years. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DNxwtZ5U8AADmWN.jpg
@EPA @ENERGY 3. United States Armed Forces- The 2014 Quadrennial Defense Review identified climate change as a significant security risk. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DNxwqYyU8AAHiUL.jpg
@EPA @ENERGY 2. State & Local Governments- They demonstrate the choice between a prosperous economy & a healthy environment is false. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DNxwf3VU8AMerJi.jpg
@EPA @ENERGY 1. Scientists- Americans rely on science everyday & climate science is still the most important input for policymakers. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DNxwZX1U8AAxvf9.jpg
@EPA @ENERGY And there are trusted voices that can move the American public and our government to action:
@EPA @ENERGY It's great the effects are sinking in, but if they don't fully acknowledge the science behind climate change, we need to act.
@EPA @ENERGY That's a start and offers hope that the U.S. can agree on steps toward climate adaptation or a common set of facts that can help us prepare.
@EPA Last month, @ENERGY Secretary Perry said there was not enough proof that humans cause climate change, but agreed the climate was warming.
@EPA Secretary of Defense James Mattis continues to warn climate change can be a driver of instability and a direct threat to national security. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DNxv0bZUMAAn2Uj.jpg
@EPA DC Republicans are finally acknowledging the the climate is changing. As of this month, 60 Members joined the Climate Solutions Caucus. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DNxvvyfU8AI1HuO.jpg
@EPA Despite the overwhelming science and public interest, the road to climate action for a Republican, is a precarious one. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DNxvmkpV4AE7cgk.png
@EPA Republican strategist Whit Ayres points out the paradox of climate action and politics. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DNxvbdhUMAAr_KQ.png
@EPA It became easier to accept alternative facts than it was to accept a climate action policy to phase out carbon emissions.
@EPA Climate action used to be bipartisan--until groups began casting doubt on climate science & intimidating Rs from supporting climate action.
@EPA And last week's draft 4-year strategic plan for the @EPA omitted the phrase "climate change" altogether. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DNxvLLHU8AAPuEA.jpg
@EPA The @EPA announced it would review recently adopted standards for automobile fuel economy. We expect these standards to be rolled back. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DNxvB9EVwAALWou.jpg
@EPA He moved to revoke the Clean Power Plan, which was expected to cut CO2 emissions from power generation 32% by 2030.
And he appointed an oil & gas industry advocate, Scott Pruitt, to be Administrator of the @EPA.
Most significant, he announced his intention for the United States to withdraw from the Paris Climate Agreement. http://pbs.twimg.com/media/DNxuz71VQAAuDfQ.jpg
As president, Trump remains committed to unwinding all the progress on climate achieved under President Obama.
